page.title: 14STANFORD JUNIOR SCHOOL
page.content: Stanford Junior School is an old school dating back to the 19th Century.The school buildings were built at different times.The first part was built in 1891 and the last part built in 1930.The school is in Corringham Rd. and consists of 3 main buildings.Part of it used to be the local secondary modern school.The old scullery used to be the domestic science room.More recently block 3 was the infant school.Today it houses a nursery, several infant classes, first year juniors and the dining areas. Blocks 1 & 2 in the other playground house 2nd, 3rd and 4th years, an opportunity unit and a tutorial unit. Play areas are concreted and the playing fields are some distance away. There are 13 teaching staff, plus the Headmaster, a remedial teacher and a teacher for short-term pupils.
